title: Sesquipedalianism
content:
Sesquipedalianism is a new font I'm working on - it comes in both serif and sans serif styles, and in regular and bold weights.   
   
 ![sesquip.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414152800im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/2819.jpg)
author: saywerd

comments.content:
There's something a bit chunky about it--the 3 pixel   
x-height in the caps is awkward. But the pseudo unicase   
makes it feel friendly. A great start.

hmmm... strange mix of square and rounded...   
how would it look if you rounded the a, m, n, and u?
